intro: Helicia platyphylla, commonly known as the broad-leaved helicia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Theaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its broad, leathery leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Helicia platyphylla is typically found in lowland tropical rainforests and is often a component of the understory vegetation. It has limited commercial use but is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
